derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: from Greek anaisthētos 'insensible', related to anaisthēsia (see anaesthesia), + -ic

entry.def: Anaesthetic is a substance that doctors use to stop you feeling pain during an operation, either in the whole of your body when you are unconscious, or in a part of your body when you are awake.

example.ex: The operation is carried out under a general anaesthetic.
example.tran: 该手术是在全身麻醉情况下实施的。

means.word_mean: 1. a drug that causes temporary loss of bodily sensations

sentences.sentence: "the young girls are in a state of possession--blind and deaf and anesthetic"
